intro: Chromolaena frustrata, commonly known as the white chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Chromolaena frustrata is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
